titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: John W. Meister (1916-1974) was a Presbyterian minister. He served as Executive Secretary of the Council of Theological Seminaries of the United Presbyterian Church. He was educated at Ohio University and Princeton Theological Seminary and served in churches in Ohio and Indiana. He was the author of What Baptism Means (1960).

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of John William Meister. Materials include: incoming and outgoing correspondence of Jack Meister as Executive Secretary of the Council on Theological Education, 1969-1971; correspondence and reports related to plans for and design of a study on theological education by Doug Trout; progress reports; financial statements and budgets of the study; corrections to the Trout Report; reports and memoranda containing responses to the report from task forces at several seminaries; a copy of Part II of the Theological Education Resources of the United Presbyterian Church for the 1970s; and a working paper from the 1969 annual meeting of Council on Theological Education.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
